title: About — NEIM: New England Integrative Medicine
cleaned_text: DR. JACQUELINE S. YANG, ND, CAc Dr. Yang is a Naturopathic Doctor and Certified Acupuncturist licensed in New Hampshire and Massachusetts. She learned the importance of nutrition and the holistic approach to one's well-being at a young age and pursued her education in advancing her knowledge and understanding in Naturopathic, Homeopathic, and Traditional Chinese Medicine and Acupuncture. She received her Bachelor of Science at Boston College in Chestnut Hill, MA, having a focus in biochemistry and chemistry. She then researched neuronal development at Harvard Medical School before receiving her doctorate in Naturopathic Medicine at the Southwest College of Naturopathic Medicine in Tempe, AZ. She is a member of the New Hampshire Association of Naturopathic Doctors and the Massachusetts Society of Naturopathic Doctors. She is an adjunct faculty member of one of the Naturopathic Medical Schools, National University of Health Sciences, in Lombard, Illinois. She also served on the New Hampshire Board of Naturopathic Examiners for 5 years. Dr. Yang has a focus in digestive disorders, allergies, autoimmune disease, cardiovascular conditions, male and female infertility, chronic fatigue, and chronic pain, but also treats most other general health concerns. She also treats chronic conditions related to environmental toxicities and inflammation. She utilizes whole food-based nutrition, Homeopathy, Botanical Medicine, and Traditional Chinese Medicine, including Acupuncture, in an integrative approach to help restore a person's health and to prevent onset of disease. Dr. Yang was interviewed by the Boston Voyager. Click [here](http://bostonvoyager.com/interview/meet-jacqueline-yang-new-england-integrative-medicine-back-bay/) to read more. Dr. Jessica Cooper, ND, CAC Dr. Cooper is a Naturopathic Doctor and Certified Acupuncturist in New Hampshire, practicing in our Salem, NH location. At the age of sixteen she discovered her love for nature and its great impact on the human body and decided to pursue a career in Naturopathic Medicine. She received her Bachelor of Science with a focus in Biology at Lebanon Valley College in Annville, PA. Immediately following her undergraduate education, Dr. Cooper enrolled at the Southwest College of Naturopathic Medicine where she graduated with honors. Upon graduation, she completed an accredited one-year residency program at the Southwest Naturopathic Medical Center. Dr. Cooper's preferred therapeutics include Botanical Medicine, Acupuncture and Traditional Chinese Medicine, Mind-Body Medicine, Nutrition, Bio-therapeutic drainage, Homeopathy, and Hydrotherapy. Aside from her medical education, she has also received education in Mayan uterine massage, Gemstone therapy, and CranioSacral therapy. Her focus is in general family medicine, women's health, mental health, endocrine and digestive disorders, and acute/chronic illness. Dr. Cooper's treatment goals are to address the mind, body, and spirit of every patient by creating individualized treatment plans. She aims to promote and maintain the health and well being of her patients by using therapies that stimulate the body's natural ability to heal. Dr. Cooper is currently a member of the American Association of Naturopathic Physicians (AANP), the New Hampshire Association of Naturopathic Doctors (NHAND), and the Pennsylvania Association of Naturopathic Physicians (PANP). Dr. David McHenry, ND Dr. McHenry is Naturopathic Doctor licensed in New Hampshire, whose practice employs the use of Talk Therapy, Lifestyle Coaching, Nutrition, Herbal Medicine, Homeopathy, Bio-identical Hormones, Hydrotherapy, and Naturopathic Physical Medicine in the treatment of acute and chronic illness. He has special interests in the areas of mental illness, addiction, LGBTI health, bio-identical hormone replacement, neurological conditions and neurodegenerative disease, gastrointestinal conditions, and autoimmune disease. Dr. McHenry grew up in southern Indiana and attended Indiana University Bloomington where he received a B.S. in Neuroscience and a B.A. in Human Biology in 2011. He received his doctorate in naturopathic medicine from the Southwest College of Naturopathic Medicine in Tempe, Arizona, in 2015. Throughout his education and career, he has been active in raising awareness of LGBTI-specific health issues within the medical community and advocates for an end to treatment disparities among minority communities. Dr. Megha Sanghi Dr. Sanghi is a Naturopathic Doctor licensed in Massachusetts and New Hampshire. Her passion for Naturopathic Medicine grew as she herself did not find solutions for her own health through traditional medicine and found relief through alternative medicine. This encouraged her to further her knowledge in natural ways to support the body's innate healing ability. She grew up in Ghana, West Africa and moved to the United States at the age of 13 to pursue boarding school in Minnesota. She moved to Boston to attend Northeastern University and graduated with a B.S. in Health Sciences with a psychology minor. She received her Doctorate in Naturopathic Medicine from National University of Health Sciences in Lombard, Illinois. Dr. Sanghi has a focus in digestive disorders, autoimmune conditions, women's health conditions, thyroid conditions, diabetes, cardiac conditions and mental health conditions such as anxiety, depression, personality disorders, etc. She works with nutrition, herbs, supplements, homeopathy, hydrotherapy, and naturopathic counseling to treat acute and chronic conditions as well as prevent the onset of disease. Hope Hernandez Hope Hernandez has worked as a medical assistant with our office since 2014. She has an interest in herbalism and cooking with medicinal herbs. Hope has 1 school age child and her hobbies include gardening, hiking, reading, and cooking. Mary LaFrance Mary LaFrance has worked in the Naturopathic community for 5+ years. She is currently our office manager. She enjoys working with people and appreciates what natural and holistic medicine proves for our patients. Mary is married with 2 grown children and 2 grandchildren. Some of her hobbies include reading, walking, knitting, and cooking.
